sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Fold to be included in the Russell 2000 Index
feed.summary: Fold Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: FLD), a bitcoin financial services company, announced its inclusion in the Russell 2000 Index. This milestone is expected to broaden market awareness and increase visibility among investors, validating Fold's position as a successful public company. The company emphasizes its strategy to integrate Bitcoin into everyday commerce, citing strong demand for its Bitcoin Gift Card and the upcoming Fold Bitcoin Rewards Credit Card.

feed.title: Fold Holdings joins Russell 2000 Index, enhancing market visibility By Investing.com
feed.summary: Fold Holdings, a bitcoin financial services company, has been included in the Russell 2000 Index, a significant milestone despite its recent stock decline. The company aims to broaden market awareness and increase visibility among investors, focusing on integrating bitcoin into everyday commerce through its products. Analysts expect a net income drop for FY2025, but the company remains committed to its growth strategy, with liquid assets exceeding short-term obligations.

feed.title: New federal bank charter lets a Bitcoin tool reach every US state
feed.summary: Fold Holdings (NASDAQ: FLD) has gained nationwide access across all 50 U.S. states for its Bitcoin financial services following a strategic partnership with BitGo Bank & Trust. This was enabled by BitGo's approval as a federally chartered bank by the OCC on December 18, 2025, allowing Fold to operate under a single, federally supervised trust framework, replacing fragmented state-by-state restrictions. This expansion facilitates access to Fold’s Bitcoin Gift Card and supports the rollout of the Fold Bitcoin Credit Card, including in previously restricted markets like New York.

feed.title: Fold Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:FLD) Given Average Recommendation of "Moderate Buy" by Analysts
feed.summary: Fold Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:FLD) has received an average rating of "Moderate Buy" from five analysts, with a 12-month average price target of $7.83. Despite missing recent earnings and revenue estimates, shares opened up 8.3% at $3.01, and institutional investors hold a significant 56.89% of the stock. Analysts have recently reiterated or upgraded their ratings for the company.

feed.title: Fold Holdings Amends Loan Agreement with Two Prime
feed.summary: Fold Holdings, through its subsidiary Fold, Inc., amended its Master Loan Agreement with Two Prime Lending Limited on November 19, 2025. This amendment increased the interest rate to 8.5% per annum and adjusted collateral levels, impacting the company's financial arrangements. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates FLD as Neutral due to significant challenges including negative profitability, liquidity issues, and a bearish technical trend.

feed.title: Fold Launches Affiliate Program as Bitcoin Gift Card Gains Momentum on Holiday Gift Guides
feed.summary: Fold Holdings, Inc. announced the launch of its new affiliate program, allowing content creators to earn commissions on sales of the Fold Bitcoin Gift Card. This initiative seeks to integrate bitcoin into everyday life by providing a unique gift option that can appreciate in value, unlike traditional gift cards. The company has partnered with Impact and plans to expand the program to include other financial products in 2026.

feed.title: Fold Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:FLD) Given Average Rating of "Moderate Buy" by Analysts
feed.summary: Fold Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:FLD) has received an average analyst rating of "Moderate Buy" from five brokerages, with an average one-year price target of $7.83. This comes despite the company missing its latest quarterly earnings estimates, reporting an EPS of ($0.15) against a consensus of ($0.12) and revenue of $7.4M compared to an estimated $9.2M. The stock currently trades around $3.04 and has significant institutional ownership.

feed.title: Supplier Spotlights: British American Tobacco, Dover Fueling Solutions & Mars Inc.
feed.summary: This article highlights new initiatives and partnerships from various convenience store suppliers, including British American Tobacco, Dover Fueling Solutions, and Mars Inc. Key announcements include Blackhawk Network expanding Bitcoin gift card distribution, BAT partnering with Accenture for operational transformation, DFS acquiring Site IQ LLC to enhance forecourt management, Ferrero Group's progress in sustainability, Honor Foods opening a new distribution center, Inmar Intelligence collaborating with Upshop for marketing and operations alignment, Mars launching the Protect the Peanut Plan, Southco Distributing Co. acquiring Atlantic Dominion Distributors' inventory assets, Vroom Delivery partnering with ADD Systems for enhanced digital commerce solutions, and Westrock Coffee Co. expanding its U.S. manufacturing operations. These developments aim to capture consumer interest, improve efficiency, and address industry challenges.

feed.title: Fold Holdings increases its holdings by 32 bitcoins, bringing the total to 1,526 bitcoins
feed.summary: Fold Holdings Inc. (FLD), a publicly listed bitcoin financial services company, has increased its bitcoin holdings by 32, bringing its total to 1,526 bitcoins. This information was reported by Foresight News based on monitoring by BitcoinTreasuries.NET.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: Fold Holdings reports Q3 2025 revenue growth, stock dips
feed.summary: Fold Holdings Inc. (FOLD) reported a 41% year-over-year revenue increase to $7.4 million for Q3 2025 and a GAAP net income of $0.6 million, a significant turnaround from a $62.3 million net loss in Q3 2024. Despite this growth and the expansion of its Bitcoin-related financial services, including the upcoming Bitcoin Rewards Credit Card and gift cards, the stock dipped 4.85% in aftermarket trading. The company emphasized its strong focus on Bitcoin-centric products and strategic partnerships for future growth, aiming for general access to its credit card in Q1 2026.

feed.title: Fold (NASDAQ: FLD) and Steak ’n Shake offer $5 bitcoin reward, first U.S. meal bundle
feed.summary: Fold (NASDAQ: FLD) has partnered with Steak 'n Shake to offer customers a $5 bitcoin reward when they purchase the "Bitcoin Meal" or "Bitcoin Steakburger." This limited-time promotion, launched on October 31, 2025, is available at approximately 400 Steak 'n Shake locations nationwide. Customers can redeem the reward by uploading their receipt to bitcoinmealdeal.com and then activating a Fold app account, marking a significant step in mainstream bitcoin adoption.

feed.title: Fold Holdings, Inc. Partners with Steak ’n Shake to Offer Bitcoin Rewards on Select Meals
feed.summary: Fold Holdings, Inc. has partnered with Steak ’n Shake to offer customers $5 in bitcoin rewards when they purchase a Bitcoin Meal or Bitcoin Steakburger at approximately 400 U.S. locations. This initiative, launching on October 31, 2025, aims to mainstream bitcoin usage by integrating it into everyday purchases, with customers redeeming rewards via the Fold app. Fold CEO Will Reeves emphasized this as a step towards normalizing bitcoin ownership and usage in daily life, with more partnerships expected.

feed.title: Fold Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:FLD) Short Interest Up 248.6% in September - MarketBeat
feed.summary: Fold Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:FLD) experienced a significant 248.6% increase in short interest in September, reaching 1,080,000 shares. Institutional investors hold approximately 56.89% of the stock, with several new stakes acquired in the second quarter. Analyst ratings are mixed, with an average "Moderate Buy" and a consensus target price of $7.83, while the company reported missing analyst earnings estimates for the last quarter.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: Fold Holdings Q2 2025 sees stock rise after earnings beat
feed.summary: Fold Holdings (FLD) reported a strong Q2 2025, with revenue up 59% year-over-year to $8.2 million and an EPS of $0.28, significantly beating forecasts. The company's stock rose 6.47% after hours, reflecting investor confidence in its expanding Bitcoin-related financial services, including upcoming gift card and credit card launches. Fold Holdings also emphasized its strategy of accumulating Bitcoin in its treasury to support its operating business and long-term value creation.

feed.title: Fold Holdings Secures $250M for Bitcoin Expansion
feed.summary: Fold Holdings reported a strong Q2 2025 with $8.2 million in revenue and $13.4 million net income, alongside significant growth in new accounts. The company secured a $250 million equity purchase facility to expand its Bitcoin holdings and plans to launch a Fold Credit Card, adding to its successful Bitcoin Gift Card. Fold's Bitcoin Investment Treasury currently holds 1,492 BTC, valued at $160 million.

feed.title: Fold Holdings Inc. (FLD) reports earnings
feed.summary: Fold Holdings Inc. (FLD) has filed its Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2024, detailing a net loss of $1,868,532 due to general and administrative expenses and a non-redemption agreement expense, despite generating significant interest income from its Trust Account. The report also highlights the completion of its business combination with Fold, Inc. on February 14, 2025, and provides an update on its financial position and strategy.
